🌨️ Problems/❄️ Overwintering collapse.title: ❄️ Overwintering collapse
🌨️ Problems/❄️ Overwintering collapse.description: Bees can die over the winter if they are too weak as they cannot warm themselves and its brood.

🌨️ Problems/🌨️ Problems.title: 🌨️ Problems
🌨️ Problems/🌨️ Problems.description: 💡 Hard, frequent, unscalable work to keep bees healthy for precise pollination and food security

🌨️ Problems/🌲 Distant locations.title: 🌲 Distant locations
🌨️ Problems/🌲 Distant locations.description: For many beekeepers, managing apiaries in distant or remote locations is both a necessity and a challenge. These locations are often chosen for their ideal foraging conditions, such as proximity to diverse flora or agricultural crops, but their remoteness introduces logistical hurdles. Regular inspections are critical to monitor hive health, check for signs of diseases or pests, and ensure sufficient food stores, especially during changing seasons. However, traveling long distances to reach these apiaries can be time-consuming, costly, and physically demanding. This challenge becomes even more pronounced for beekeepers managing multiple apiaries scattered across different regions.

🌨️ Problems/🌻 Precise pollination.title: 🌻 Precise pollination
🌨️ Problems/🌻 Precise pollination.description: A global issue is food security, efficiency of growing crops and precise pollination as a solution.

🌨️ Problems/🍯 Counterfeit honey.title: 🍯 Counterfeit honey
🌨️ Problems/🍯 Counterfeit honey.description: Counterfeit honey has become a growing challenge for beekeepers, consumers, and the entire apiculture industry. This problem arises when honey products are adulterated with cheaper sweeteners like corn syrup, rice syrup, or other non-natural additives. Some counterfeit honey is even produced entirely synthetically, bypassing bees altogether. This fraudulent practice not only undermines the hard work of ethical beekeepers but also devalues the purity and quality of real honey. For consumers, the consequences include unwittingly purchasing products with little nutritional value, potentially harmful chemicals, and none of the beneficial enzymes and nutrients that genuine honey provides. On a larger scale, the prevalence of counterfeit honey erodes trust in the market, making it harder for ethical producers to compete and sustain their livelihoods.

🌨️ Problems/🍽️ Bee colony starvation.title: 🍽️ Bee colony starvation
🌨️ Problems/🍽️ Bee colony starvation.description: One of the most pressing challenges beekeepers face is bee colony starvation, a condition where bees lack access to sufficient food resources to sustain their population. This often results from a combination of environmental and agricultural factors. Seasonal changes, such as harsh winters or late springs, can limit the availability of flowering plants that provide nectar and pollen. Additionally, monoculture farming practices create vast areas with limited biodiversity, leaving bees without access to diverse and continuous food sources. When bees cannot find adequate nutrition, their weakened colonies become more vulnerable to disease, pests like Varroa mites, and other stressors that can lead to collapse.

🌨️ Problems/🎒 Challenging to become a ne.id: 🌨️ Problems/🎒 Challenging to become a new beekeeper
🌨️ Problems/🎒 Challenging to become a ne.title: 🎒 Challenging to become a new beekeeper
🌨️ Problems/🎒 Challenging to become a ne.description: Beekeeping is an age-old craft that plays a critical role in pollination and food production. Yet, for aspiring beekeepers, the journey to start their first hive can be daunting. The steep learning curve, upfront costs for equipment, and lack of access to hands-on guidance often discourage newcomers. Mismanaging a hive can lead to issues like colony collapse, diseases, or aggressive behavior, further intimidating beginners. With bees facing global threats such as habitat loss and pesticides, it’s essential to make beekeeping more accessible to support pollinator populations.

🌨️ Problems/🏘️ Bees attacking neighbours.title: 🏘️ Bees attacking neighbours
🌨️ Problems/🏘️ Bees attacking neighbours.description: One of the most common challenges beekeepers face, particularly in urban or suburban settings, is managing aggressive bee behavior, which can lead to bees attacking neighbors. While bees are generally non-aggressive and focused on their work of pollination, factors like hive overcrowding, poor queen genetics, environmental stress, or disturbances can trigger defensive behavior. Aggressive bees may venture beyond their hive, creating risks for nearby residents, pets, and outdoor activities. This not only poses safety concerns but also strains community relations, potentially resulting in complaints or even the forced removal of hives. Beekeepers must tread a careful balance, ensuring their hives thrive while minimizing their impact on the surrounding environment.

🌨️ Problems/🏘️ Multiple apiaries.title: 🏘️ Multiple apiaries
🌨️ Problems/🏘️ Multiple apiaries.description: Related to 💪🏻 Unscalable work, problem is that with growth of the colony numbers, beekeepers need to place bees closer and more even across the land to avoid 🌻 Precise pollination

🌨️ Problems/🐭 Mice killing a colony.title: 🐭 Mice killing a colony
🌨️ Problems/🐭 Mice killing a colony.description: In summer a hive of 50,000 to 60,000 bees can defend itself against intruders like mice. In winter population is reduced to 20,000 bees. Too cold to fly out and defend. The mice urinate and deficate on frames and destroy the wax foundations.

🌨️ Problems/🐻 Bears destroying hives & c.title: 🐻 Bears destroying hives & colonies
🌨️ Problems/🐻 Bears destroying hives & c.description: One of the significant challenges faced by beekeepers, especially in regions inhabited by bears, is the destruction of hives by these powerful animals. Bears are naturally drawn to beehives due to their insatiable appetite for honey and protein-rich bee larvae. Unfortunately, this hunger often leads to devastating consequences for apiaries, with entire hives being ripped apart in mere minutes. Beyond the immediate destruction, bear attacks can wipe out months of beekeepers' hard work, disrupt pollination efforts, and threaten the health of local ecosystems reliant on bees. For small-scale beekeepers, such incidents can be financially crippling, making this a pressing issue that demands innovative solutions.

🌨️ Problems/👁️ Observability of bee colo.title: 👁️ Observability of bee colony
🌨️ Problems/👁️ Observability of bee colo.description: Probably the biggest problem for the beekeeper is that it is hard to make decisions without up-to-date and correct information about the colony development.  See 🧑‍🚀 Actions beekeepers make

🌨️ Problems/👁️ Time-consuming inspection.title: 👁️ Time-consuming inspections
🌨️ Problems/👁️ Time-consuming inspection.description: Beekeeping, while rewarding, is a labor-intensive practice, and one of the most time-consuming aspects is hive inspection. Traditional inspections require beekeepers to open hives manually, often disrupting the bees' natural activities and exposing them to environmental stressors. Each inspection involves checking for signs of pests, diseases, and overall colony health, a task that demands both expertise and hours of meticulous work. For larger apiaries, this process can quickly become overwhelming, leading to delays in addressing critical issues. Missing early signs of problems such as Varroa mite infestations or poor queen health can have devastating consequences for the colony, further complicating the beekeeper's already demanding responsibilities.

🌨️ Problems/💀 Alcohol washing killing be.title: 💀 Alcohol washing killing bees
🌨️ Problems/💀 Alcohol washing killing be.description: Beekeepers worldwide face a persistent challenge in maintaining the health of their colonies: accurately monitoring Varroa mite infestations. These parasitic mites are a major threat to honeybee populations, weakening colonies by feeding on developing bees and spreading viruses. To assess the level of infestation, many beekeepers rely on alcohol wash tests, a method that involves shaking a sample of bees in alcohol to separate and count the mites. While this method is highly effective in determining mite loads, it comes at the cost of sacrificing hundreds of bees from the hive—a practice that many beekeepers find distressing and counterproductive to their conservation efforts.

🌨️ Problems/💀 Colony with drone-laying q.title: 💀 Colony with drone-laying queen
🌨️ Problems/💀 Colony with drone-laying q.description: One significant challenge beekeepers face is the occurrence of a colony with a drone-laying queen. This abnormal situation arises when a queen bee begins laying unfertilized eggs, which develop into drones—male bees that are unable to contribute to the colony's honey production or survival. A drone-laying queen typically results from poor genetics, stress, or aging. Beekeepers can find themselves in a precarious situation because drone-laying queens fail to produce the necessary worker bees, which are critical for maintaining hive productivity and health.

🌨️ Problems/💀 Colony without a queen.title: 💀 Colony without a queen
🌨️ Problems/💀 Colony without a queen.description: A colony without a queen is one of the most significant challenges beekeepers face, as the queen plays a crucial role in maintaining the hive's population and overall health. Without a queen, the hive becomes queenless and cannot reproduce worker bees, leading to a decline in the workforce. Over time, this reduces the hive's ability to gather food, care for brood, and defend itself from pests. Queenless hives often experience confusion and stress, which can make the colony vulnerable to disease, robbing, or even collapse. The beekeeper must either introduce a new queen or allow the bees to raise a new one, which can be time-consuming and complex.

🌨️ Problems/💀 Intrusive inspections.title: 💀 Intrusive inspections
🌨️ Problems/💀 Intrusive inspections.description: One of the biggest challenges beekeepers face is the need for intrusive inspections. These inspections often require opening up the hive to check on the colony's health, check for diseases, or monitor honey stores. While necessary for maintaining a healthy hive, these inspections can be stressful for the bees, which may result in agitation or disruption of hive activities. This stress can also make the bees more prone to defensive behaviors, leading to increased risk of stings for the beekeeper. Frequent inspections also disrupt the bees' natural rhythms, potentially affecting the colony's productivity and overall wellbeing.

🌨️ Problems/💢 Aggressive bee colonies.title: 💢 Aggressive bee colonies
🌨️ Problems/💢 Aggressive bee colonies.description: Beekeepers are dealing with aggressive bee colonies. Aggression in bees can manifest as heightened defensiveness, leading to stinging events not only for the beekeeper but also for neighboring colonies, wildlife, and even visitors. This aggressive behavior can arise from a variety of factors, including poor hive management, environmental stressors, genetic traits, or even the presence of predators. When bees feel threatened, they may become more defensive, leading to increased risks for beekeepers and a disruption in the overall hive health. Managing aggressive bees becomes critical to maintaining a peaceful, productive apiary.

🌨️ Problems/💢 Hornet attacks.title: 💢 Hornet attacks
🌨️ Problems/💢 Hornet attacks.description: Hornet attacks pose a significant threat to beekeepers and their colonies, especially in areas where hornet species, such as the Asian giant hornet, are prevalent. These hornets are highly aggressive and can decimate entire bee colonies in a matter of days. The hornets typically target honeybees for their larvae, and they use their strength to kill the bees by decapitating them. Once a hornet has successfully infiltrated the hive, it will kill several bees before returning to its nest to feed its young. This devastating behavior can leave beekeepers with weakened colonies, reduced honey production, and the risk of losing an entire hive.

🌨️ Problems/💢 Robbing state.title: 💢 Robbing state
🌨️ Problems/💢 Robbing state.description: One of the major challenges faced by beekeepers is the robbing state of bees, which occurs when a weak or stressed colony becomes the target of other, more aggressive bees. During robbing, bees from stronger hives invade a weakened colony to steal honey and pollen. This situation can escalate quickly, leading to the collapse of the robbed hive, as the invaders overwhelm the colony’s defenses. Robbing is often triggered by environmental stressors such as a dearth of nectar, poor hive management, or weak bee populations. It poses a significant threat, not only reducing honey production but also disrupting the colony's survival.

🌨️ Problems/💪🏻 Physical labor.title: 💪🏻 Physical labor
🌨️ Problems/💪🏻 Physical labor.description: A single healthy colony over the season can collect 40-80 kg of honey.

🌨️ Problems/💪🏻 Unscalable work.title: 💪🏻 Unscalable work
🌨️ Problems/💪🏻 Unscalable work.description: Linear scaling of physical work as you add more hives and as they grow in height

🌨️ Problems/📦 Warehouse organization.title: 📦 Warehouse organization
🌨️ Problems/📦 Warehouse organization.description: Beekeepers need to maintain various warehouse management tasks and organize their equipment

🌨️ Problems/🗃️ Poor hive ventilation.title: 🗃️ Poor hive ventilation
🌨️ Problems/🗃️ Poor hive ventilation.description: One of the most critical challenges faced by beekeepers is poor hive ventilation, which can have significant implications for the health and productivity of a colony. Bees naturally regulate the temperature and humidity within the hive to ensure the survival of their brood and the proper functioning of the hive. However, inadequate airflow can lead to excessive moisture buildup and heat, creating an environment that promotes disease and stress. This, in turn, weakens the colony, makes them more susceptible to pests like mites, and affects their ability to forage effectively.

🌨️ Problems/🗃️ Storm wind collapsing bee.title: 🗃️ Storm wind collapsing beehives
🌨️ Problems/🗃️ Storm wind collapsing bee.description: Flimsy beehives present a significant challenge for beekeepers, especially in regions where weather conditions are unpredictable and harsh. High winds can easily topple or push over a poorly constructed hive, leaving the colony vulnerable to cold temperatures. In these situations, the bees may not be able to regulate their environment, and the cold can quickly lead to the death of the colony. Additionally, beehives with wide or inadequately secured entrances can exacerbate the situation. When winds push air into the hive, it can chill the brood, weakening the colony and making it more susceptible to collapse. Beekeepers who fail to secure their hives may face catastrophic losses as the hive structure becomes compromised by the elements.

🌨️ Problems/🗃️ Ugly beehives.title: 🗃️ Ugly beehives
🌨️ Problems/🗃️ Ugly beehives.description: Many beekeepers face is the physical deterioration of their hives. Traditional wooden beehives often suffer from rotting or weakening, particularly in harsh weather conditions. The materials used to construct these hives—such as wood, bricks, and even old tires as stands—can be prone to damage and decay over time. Beekeepers may use bricks on the roof to prevent wind damage, but this makeshift solution can lead to added weight and unnecessary stress on the hive structure. Additionally, the use of asbestos roofing in older hives presents both health and environmental concerns, as it is harmful to both the bees and the beekeeper when deteriorated.

🌨️ Problems/🦀 Diseases.title: 🦀 Diseases
🌨️ Problems/🦀 Diseases.description: Beekeepers face numerous challenges when it comes to maintaining healthy hives, and one of the most pressing concerns is the prevalence of diseases, particularly viral and bacterial infections. Viruses such as Chronic Bee Paralysis Virus (CBPV), Israeli Acute Paralysis Virus (IAPV), and Lake Sinai Virus (LSV) pose significant threats to bee colonies. CBPV causes paralysis in adult bees, rendering them unable to fly or perform their essential tasks, which weakens the entire hive. IAPV and LSV are linked to colony collapse disorder (CCD), where the bees abandon the hive, leading to a rapid decline in population. Identifying and mitigating these viruses is crucial for ensuring the survival of bee colonies, as they have a direct impact on pollination and agricultural ecosystems.

🌨️ Problems/🦀 Infestations.title: 🦀 Infestations
🌨️ Problems/🦀 Infestations.description: Beekeepers face numerous challenges when it comes to protecting their hives, with infestations of pests like Varroa destructor and Tropilaelaps mites being among the most detrimental. These parasitic mites invade beehives, feeding on the blood of honeybees, weakening the colony by spreading diseases such as deformed wing virus. The infestation often goes unnoticed until it has already caused severe damage, as the mites tend to remain hidden in brood cells. Without timely intervention, these mites can decimate entire hives, leading to significant losses for beekeepers and threatening pollination systems that are crucial to agriculture.

🌨️ Problems/🧶 Swarming.title: 🧶 Swarming
🌨️ Problems/🧶 Swarming.description: Swarming is one of the most significant challenges beekeepers face, as it occurs when a large group of bees leaves the hive to form a new colony, usually during the warmer months. This behavior is a natural process for bee reproduction, but it can lead to the loss of a substantial portion of the colony and disrupt honey production. Beekeepers often struggle to detect the early signs of swarming, such as increased queen cell formation or the hive becoming overcrowded, which makes it difficult to intervene in time. Without proper intervention, swarming can result in a weakened colony, reduced honey yield, and the need for the beekeeper to manage the new swarm.

🌻 Purpose/🌻 Purpose.title: 🌻 Purpose
🌻 Purpose/🌻 Purpose.description: Gratheon develops an open, modular, roboticbeehive as a data service for 👨🏻‍🚀 Semi-professional beekeepers to save bees 🐝, improve efficiency and increase food security through scalable precise pollination.

🌻 Purpose/Company mission.title: Company mission
🌻 Purpose/Company mission.description: As humanity expands its technological horizons, building new types of spaceships and dreaming of distant planets,  we continue to grapple with wars, climate change, social inequality, population of 10 billion and malnutrition. In these challenging times, we turn our attention to a small insect - the key to plant life reproduction.

🌻 Purpose/Ethics.title: Ethics ☯️
🌻 Purpose/Ethics.description: Ethics is a branch of philosophy that deals with the study of what is morally right or wrong, good or bad.

🌻 Purpose/Naming.title: Naming
🌻 Purpose/Naming.description: Company name has multiple meanings on different layers, so there is no definitive answer

🌻 Purpose/Symbolism.title: Symbolism
🌻 Purpose/Symbolism.description: Colors represent main wavelengths that 🐝 bees can see, company values and other associations:

company/🍰 Equity and fundraising plan.title: 🍰 Equity and fundraising plan
company/🍰 Equity and fundraising plan.description: 💡 This page is summarizing the long-term plan of the equity program for the employees, founders, investors and advisors. At this phase these are just fantasies, but it should give insight for investors and potential employees into our 🫀 Culture and values and reasoning

company/🤲 Why open source.title: 🤲 Why open source
company/🤲 Why open source.description: Many investors and mentors are surprised to see us open source. This page clarifies reasoning behind such decision.

company/🫀 Culture and values/🫀 Culture a.id: company/🫀 Culture and values/🫀 Culture and values
company/🫀 Culture and values/🫀 Culture a.title: 🫀 Culture and values
company/🫀 Culture and values/🫀 Culture a.description: Cultural values affects how we do things internally, which clients and employees align with us.

company/🫀 Culture and values/Adapt to ch.id: company/🫀 Culture and values/Adapt to change 🏕️
company/🫀 Culture and values/Adapt to ch.title: Adapt to change 🏕️
company/🫀 Culture and values/Adapt to ch.description: Be bold, get things done, take responsibility. Get hands dirty, take small steps, be prepared, survive, speed, autonomy, freedom

company/🫀 Culture and values/Ethical hea.title: Ethical heart 🌳
company/🫀 Culture and values/Ethical hea.description: Care about sentient organisms. Go beyond product to have sustainable ecosystem and environment. Balance work and life

company/🫀 Culture and values/Gather valu.title: Gather value 🍯
company/🫀 Culture and values/Gather valu.description: Bring value, create symbiotic relations, enrich all parties. We bring value to beekeepers and to our team. Grow wider in your abilities and knowledge to bring more impact.

company/🫀 Culture and values/Humbly kind.title: Humbly kind 🧸
company/🫀 Culture and values/Humbly kind.description: Be empathetic, support, teach. Everyone makes mistakes. Accepting flaws with kindness leads to unity and trust.

company/🫀 Culture and values/New horizon.title: New horizons 🏔️
company/🫀 Culture and values/New horizon.description: Reach mastery and wisdom. Improve continuously, grow above yourself, define new norm, withstand the test of time, quality, performance. Reach equilibrium of opposing values, opinions and responsibilities.

company/🫀 Culture and values/Observable.title: Observable mind 🧿
company/🫀 Culture and values/Observable.description: Value rationalism, science, innovation that has built the modern civilisation. Cultivate creative and critical thinking, data-driven decisions and experimentation

company/🫀 Culture and values/Radiate tru.title: Radiate truth 🌞
company/🫀 Culture and values/Radiate tru.description: Be joyful and honest, have fun. Be open and transparent to the world. Communicate to reduce boundaries, complexity, be predictable to be trusted.

company/🫀 Culture and values/Team effort.title: Team effort 🐝
company/🫀 Culture and values/Team effort.description: Be part of the collective, make friends, communicate, lead by example, equal voice, take ownership, disagree and commit

company/index.title: 👔 Company
company/index.description: 💡 This is a placeholder page for how the company should like.

company/Processes/☑️ Features and tasks.title: ☑️ Features and tasks
company/Processes/☑️ Features and tasks.description: We think of product development as a hierarchy of abstractions:

company/Processes/🎥 Meeting recordings.title: 🎥 Meeting recordings
company/Processes/🎥 Meeting recordings.description: Following Radiate truth 🌞value, we are transparent in internal communications, which is important in modern asynchroneous world. Thats why we record important meetings.

company/Processes/🖥️ Services and tools.id: company/Processes/🖥️ Services and tools that we use
company/Processes/🖥️ Services and tools.title: 🖥️ Services and tools that we use

company/Team/Roles/Response templates/Re.title: Response templates
company/Team/Roles/Response templates/Re.description: If you’re reading this and thinking “what, a template? generic answers?”, then yes.

company/Team/Roles/Roles.title: Roles
company/Team/Roles/Roles.description: Here we list roles that are needed for company operation

index.title: Overview
index.description: Gratheon develops open, modular robotic beehive as a service for 👨🏻‍🚀 Semi-professional beekeepers to save bees 🐝, improve efficiency and increase food security through scalable precise pollination.

products/🧑‍🚀 Actions beekeepers make.title: 🧑‍🚀 Actions beekeepers make
products/🧑‍🚀 Actions beekeepers make.description: Beekeeping is not only about watching the bees. Beekeeping in practice is a reactive (and if you are good - proactive) decision making to solve or prevent described Problems. To link problems with our product solutions its good to list these decisions and actions..

products/beehive_camera/features/🎥 Video.title: 🎥 Video streaming via API
products/beehive_camera/features/🎥 Video.description: We want to integrate hardware that cannot run GPU inferencing efficiently, but has sufficient network bandwidth to capture and upload/stream video to the cloud

products/beehive_camera/ideas/🌻 Detect b.id: products/beehive_camera/ideas/🌻 Detect bees with pollen for foraging statistics
products/beehive_camera/ideas/🌻 Detect b.title: 🌻 Detect bees with pollen for foraging statistics
products/beehive_camera/ideas/🌻 Detect b.description: We want to allow users to see bee foraging behaviour over time.

products/beehive_camera/ideas/🎮 Client-s.title: 🎮 Client-side app with UI
products/beehive_camera/ideas/🎮 Client-s.description: In case internet is not available, we should still be able to display some statistics on the display (if its available) to the beekeeper. So we need some hive-app interface for this.

products/beehive_camera/ideas/🐝 Detect s.id: products/beehive_camera/ideas/🐝 Detect swarming from entrance video
products/beehive_camera/ideas/🐝 Detect s.title: 🐝 Detect swarming from entrance video

products/beehive_camera/ideas/🐝 Guard de.title: 🐝 Guard detection
products/beehive_camera/ideas/🐝 Guard de.description: Bees on a landing platform typically have some bees that are guarding the entrance from

products/beehive_camera/ideas/👑 Detect q.id: products/beehive_camera/ideas/👑 Detect queen mating from entrance video
products/beehive_camera/ideas/👑 Detect q.title: 👑 Detect queen mating from entrance video

products/beehive_camera/ideas/🔔 Daily lo.id: products/beehive_camera/ideas/🔔 Daily loss of bees stats and alert based on counter
products/beehive_camera/ideas/🔔 Daily lo.title: 🔔 Daily loss of bees stats and alert based on counter

products/beehive_camera/ideas/🔔 Robbing.id: products/beehive_camera/ideas/🔔 Robbing behaviour alert based on bee counter
products/beehive_camera/ideas/🔔 Robbing.title: 🔔 Robbing behaviour alert based on bee counter

products/beehive_camera/ideas/🤢 Detect p.title: 🤢 Detect pesticide exposure
products/beehive_camera/ideas/🤢 Detect p.description: This requires access to video of hive internals

products/beehive_camera/todo/🎮 Device ma.title: 🎮 Device management - Remote desktop
products/beehive_camera/todo/🎮 Device ma.description: To ease management of the device, beekeeper should be able to inspect device remotely over local network. This assumes that beekeeper has set up the device and its operational based on instructions: How to setup Remote Desktop connection (to Jetson Orin / Nano)

products/beehive_camera/todo/📈 Count bee.id: products/beehive_camera/todo/📈 Count bees coming in and out - on the edge
products/beehive_camera/todo/📈 Count bee.title: 📈 Count bees coming in and out - on the edge
products/beehive_camera/todo/📈 Count bee.description: This task is one of the main features of the Entrance Observer product

products/beehive_camera/todo/🦀 Varroa mi.id: products/beehive_camera/todo/🦀 Varroa mite new infestation detection from video
products/beehive_camera/todo/🦀 Varroa mi.title: 🦀 Varroa mite new infestation detection from video
products/beehive_camera/todo/🦀 Varroa mi.description: This is an extension of varroa mite detection that is done from frame photos.

products/clients/👨🏻 Potential new beekee.title: 👨🏻 Potential new beekeepers
products/clients/👨🏻 Potential new beekee.description: - Someone like 🧑‍🚀 Hobby beekeepers or 🧑🏻‍🌾 Farmers who wants to take care of bees but is afraid and lacks information

products/clients/👨🏻‍💻 Tech-savvy enginee.title: 👨🏻‍💻 Tech-savvy engineers
products/clients/👨🏻‍💻 Tech-savvy enginee.description: - Tech enthusiasts willing to tinker with software and hardware

products/clients/👨🏻‍🚒 Industrial beekeep.title: 👨🏻‍🚒 Industrial beekeepers
products/clients/👨🏻‍🚒 Industrial beekeep.description: - Pollination services for farmers ~90% of income

products/clients/👩🏻 Tech scale-up compan.title: 👩🏻 Tech scale-up companies
products/clients/👩🏻 Tech scale-up compan.description: - High tech companies For example organizations such as LHV, TalTech, Pipedrive do have bees on rooftops

products/clients/👩🏼‍🏫 Urban beekeepers.title: 👩🏼‍🏫 Urban beekeepers
products/clients/👩🏼‍🏫 Urban beekeepers.description: An extension of Backyard beekeepers, but in city area where main concern is ability to inspect bees without too much swarming hassle affecting neighbours

products/clients/🧑🏻‍🌾 Farmers.title: 🧑🏻‍🌾 Farmers
products/clients/🧑🏻‍🌾 Farmers.description: - Main motivation - improving yields with 🌻 Precise pollination

products/clients/🧑‍🚀 Hobby beekeepers.title: 🧑‍🚀 Hobby beekeepers
products/clients/🧑‍🚀 Hobby beekeepers.description: Owns a house outside of the city

products/index.title: 🍯 Products
products/index.description: Our products are in development and are a mix of software and hardware, complimenting each other and offering data gathering, analytics and actionable decisions that a beekeeper would need to solve day to day 🌨️ Problems

products/prices.title: ⚖️ Pricing
products/prices.description: Our base application can be used by itself to manage apiary data. Storing data, running servers and maintaining them is not free, so we offer a subscription model with these billing tiers:

products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🤖 Moving r.title: 🤖 Moving robot between hives
products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🤖 Moving r.description: Idea that [Natalia Kinash](https://www.notion.so/Natalia-Kinash-6f77baebfee945acbe6221b0776ac498?pvs=21) and myself had. If we have a robotic hive and its fully autonomous, we could place it on wheels and have it move from one location to another a-la starship delivery bots.

products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🦀 Varroa m.id: products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🦀 Varroa mite detection with infra-red camera
products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🦀 Varroa m.title: 🦀 Varroa mite detection with infra-red camera
products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🦀 Varroa m.description: An idea coming from this research paper:

products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🦾 Cross-fa.id: products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🦾 Cross-family frame movement resource balancing
products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🦾 Cross-fa.title: 🦾 Cross-family frame movement resource balancing

products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🚛 Robot mo.id: products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🚛 Robot moving hives between fields
products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🚛 Robot mo.title: 🚛 Robot moving hives between fields
products/robotic_apiary/ideas/🚛 Robot mo.description: The problem here is that say you have 3 fields with a monocultural crop. If you place hives near it, the crops bloom ends and now your bees can’t gather anything. So you want to solve monocultural crop problems with mobile apiaries. But we don’t want to use human labour of loading and unloading hives.

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🎮 Client-.id: products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🎮 Client-side app with UI in manual override mode
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🎮 Client-.title: 🎮 Client-side app with UI in manual override mode
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🎮 Client-.description: This task is about controlling robot fully locally (offline). For this we need an app and a UI.

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🎮 Connect.id: products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🎮 Connecting robot to web-app UX
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🎮 Connect.title: 🎮 Connecting robot to web-app UX

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🐝 Bee nur.title: 🐝 Bee nursing video analysis
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🐝 Bee nur.description: Video inferencing of on-frame nursing behaviour and bee tracking

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🐝 Bee spe.title: 🐝 Bee specialization classification
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🐝 Bee spe.description: We want to show demographics of bee colony for beekeeper to know about development cycle

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🔊 Audio-i.id: products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🔊 Audio-interface to talk to bees
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🔊 Audio-i.title: 🔊 Audio-interface to talk to bees

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🔥 Hive he.title: 🔥 Hive heating
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🔥 Hive he.description: Idea is to have hive heated from the bottom to combat varroa. For winter time this may also help in case of harsh degrees

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🤖 Talk to.id: products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🤖 Talk to bee colony with AI
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🤖 Talk to.title: 🤖 Talk to bee colony with AI

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🦾 Moveabl.id: products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🦾 Moveable hive bottom with varroa counting
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🦾 Moveabl.title: 🦾 Moveable hive bottom with varroa counting
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🦾 Moveabl.description: The idea here is to have hive bottom painted white and have it extracted into the hive robotic area such that we could take a photo, upload it to the web-app and count detected varroa mites to help measuring Varroa infestation management

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🦾 Robotic.id: products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🦾 Robotic insertion of new frames
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🦾 Robotic.title: 🦾 Robotic insertion of new frames

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🧪 Automat.title: 🧪 Automatic acid treatment against varroa

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🛑 Close m.id: products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🛑 Close mechanised hive entrance in case of robbing behaviour
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🛑 Close m.title: 🛑 Close mechanised hive entrance in case of robbing behaviour

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🛑 Close m.id: products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🛑 Close mechanized hive entrance in case of hornet attack
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🛑 Close m.title: 🛑 Close mechanized hive entrance in case of hornet attack
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🛑 Close m.description: The idea here is that a beehive entrance can be automated to open and close either remotely or due to other features:

products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🛑 Mechani.id: products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🛑 Mechanically reduce hive entrance in case of high wind
products/robotic_beehive/ideas/🛑 Mechani.title: 🛑 Mechanically reduce hive entrance in case of high wind

products/robotic_beehive/todo/📸 Full hiv.title: 📸 Full hive inspection
products/robotic_beehive/todo/📸 Full hiv.description: The idea is to do batch scan of beehive frames

products/sensors/ideas/🌪️ Wind speed mea.title: 🌪️ Wind speed measurement - Anemometer
products/sensors/ideas/🌪️ Wind speed mea.description: Measure speed of wind at individual hive to know wind speed affecting bees flying patterns, example - https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005003040267066.html

products/sensors/ideas/🔗 Home-assistant.title: 🔗 Home-assistant integration
products/sensors/ideas/🔗 Home-assistant.description: Give user an ability to see and operate a robot without Gratheon app, using

products/sensors/todo/🌡️ Internal Temper.title: 🌡️ Internal Temperature monitoring
products/sensors/todo/🌡️ Internal Temper.description: Goal of this feature is to predict ❄️ Overwintering collapse at winter time and detect 🗃️ Poor hive ventilation at summer time by measuring temperature from inside the hive.

products/sensors/todo/🐻 Tampering detect.title: 🐻 Tampering detection
products/sensors/todo/🐻 Tampering detect.description: The idea is to have a sensor inside a hive that detects situations when hive is tampered with, moved, inspected etc.

products/web_app/community-tier/🙅 User a.title: 🙅 User account deletion
products/web_app/community-tier/🙅 User a.description: As a requirement for https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/13327111 we need to comply and allow account deletion along with related data

products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.title: ♻️ Apiary position sharing
products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.description: This is a relatively low impact task, but one of growth-loop features.

products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.title: ♻️ Public beehive view
products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.description: For Growth loops and marketing, we need users to be able to share their beehive view with others

products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 🎒 Product onboarding videos & UI
products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.description: Need to explain all of the product features to the user

products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.id: products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Frame side queen cup detection
products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 🐝 Frame side queen cup detection
👑 Queen management
products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.description: This feature expands on to Queen detection and adds more sub-features, such as

products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.id: products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/📍 Show close-by beekeepers from government registry
products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 📍 Show close-by beekeepers from government registry
products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.description: This feature is very similar to Apiary position sharing. But instead of using data of our registered users, we want to import and synchronize data from governmental registries, so that users do not need to go outside of the app but can still see relevant information

products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.id: products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/🧑‍🚀 User email verification and change
products/web_app/community-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 🧑‍🚀 User email verification and change

products/web_app/essential-tier/🍭 Feedin.title: 🍭 Feeding management
products/web_app/essential-tier/🍭 Feedin.description: So the goal of this set of features is to allow beekeeper to mark colony as having a treatment (sugar syrup, tymol candy etc.). This is very similar to Varroa Treatment diary.

products/web_app/essential-tier/🤖 Beekee.title: 🤖 Beekeeping advice with LLM
products/web_app/essential-tier/🤖 Beekee.description: We want AI to give assistance to a beekeeper based on overall status of the beehive, taking into account all available context

products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.id: products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/☀️ Solar radiance as weather datasource
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.title: ☀️ Solar radiance as weather datasource
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.description: Hypothesis is that the sun can influence bee behaviour as well as plants secreting the nectar.

products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.title: ♻️ QR-code printing & scanning
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.description: - This may be useful for Industrial beekeepers with 100 hives that don’t use numeric system or don’t want to search for it in the app.

products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.id: products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/♻️ Share of beehive inspection public URL
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.title: ♻️ Share of beehive inspection public URL
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.description: Similar to Apiary position sharing, we want to have more social / growth loop like features that will allow collaboration between beekeepers.

products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 🌻 Flower blooming map
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.description: Idea is to show when specific flower within apiary vicinity is blooming.

products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 🐝 Frame analysis - chilled brood
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.description: when colony is not large enough to maintain temparature of the entire brood nest

products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.id: products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/📦 Manual inspections - Bulk file upload
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 📦 Manual inspections - Bulk file upload
🔔  Alerts
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.description: We want to notify beekeeper in various cases/features. For that we need a generic way to create and list alerts. We want to store alerts in DB and display them in UI.

products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.id: products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/🔔 Frame analysis - spotty brood pattern detection
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 🔔 Frame analysis - spotty brood pattern detection
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.description: spotty laying pattern = bad cells, brood pathogen of larvae, queen failure

products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.id: products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/🔔 Frame analysis - starvation detection and alert
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 🔔 Frame analysis - starvation detection and alert
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.description: - little capped honey or nectar in the hive

products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 🦀 Varroa infestation management
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.description: This is a parent feature of

products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.title: 🛰️ Apiary satellite view
products/web_app/essential-tier/ideas 💡/.description: See also Pollination optimization with hive placement recommendation

products/web_app/pro tier/🎥 Video stream.title: 🎥 Video streaming from phone

products/web_app/pro tier/📅 Varroa Treat.title: 📅 Varroa Treatment diary
products/web_app/pro tier/📅 Varroa Treat.description: For anti-varroa treatment, it would be nice to have ability to mark last time a colony was treated

products/web_app/pro tier/📈 Count bees -.id: products/web_app/pro tier/📈 Count bees - in the cloud
products/web_app/pro tier/📈 Count bees -.title: 📈 Count bees - in the cloud

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/↔️ Cre.title: ↔️ Create colony split
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/↔️ Cre.description: Similar to Multiple colony unification, beekeepers at the summer may have very big colonies that they want to split to prevent swarming.

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/♻️ Hiv.title: ♻️ Hive ownership transfer
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/♻️ Hiv.description: The idea behind this feature is that beekeepers tend to buy NUCs (bee packages) from other beekeepers. It would be good if history of past bees was passed down between people.

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/♻️ Sha.title: ♻️ Share video stream
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/♻️ Sha.description: The goal of this feature is to promote / market the app as Growth loops

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/⚖️ Col.title: ⚖️ Colony comparison
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/⚖️ Col.description: Like git diff, for analysis you may want to compare colony development over time

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🌎 Map.title: 🌎 Map view
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🌎 Map.description: Goal is for Industrial beekeepers to be able to see the big picture of their apiaries to

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🌞 Apia.id: products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🌞 Apiary top-down view of  relative to the sun
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🌞 Apia.title: 🌞 Apiary top-down view of  relative to the sun
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🌞 Apia.description: Very related to Apiary satellite view, here we care about beehive placement relative to the sun and shade

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🌻 Poll.id: products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🌻 Pollination optimization with hive placement recommendation
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🌻 Poll.title: 🌻 Pollination optimization with hive placement recommendation
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🌻 Poll.description: - Find specific crop fields for specialized (buckweed) pollination and honey harvesting

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🎮 Devi.title: 🎮 Device management
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🎮 Devi.description: To ease connecting web-app to Entrance Observer, Beehive IoT sensors, Robotic Beehive and other third-party ([Beep.nl weight telemetry integration](https://www.notion.so/Beep-nl-weight-telemetry-integration-a72ed2ce25004a3c853bb41fa08abc48?pvs=21)) we need a separate view for managing devices.

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐜 Ant.title: 🐜 Ant detection
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐜 Ant.description: Colony can fully leave the hive in case of (argentine) ant infestation, so this is an important task

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Anal.id: products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Analytics - demography and simulation
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Anal.title: 🐝 Analytics - demography and simulation
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Anal.description: - With bee demography, beekeepers can unify colonies to help with overwitnering

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Bee.title: 🐝 Bee age classification
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Bee.description: like with human societies, we need to evaluate demographical column of the colony

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Bee.title: 🐝 Bee pose - morphometric model
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Bee.description: The precondition of this feature is an access to video as a source. So either

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Wax.title: 🐝 Wax moth detection
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🐝 Wax.description: Wax moths typically take over very weak colonies or stored bee frames. So this is a low-priority detection

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/📅 Goog.title: 📅 Google-calendar integration
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/📅 Goog.description: To help beekeepers do Varroa Treatment diary and plan their events without the need of using our app all the time, we should integrate popular google calendar to synchronize events

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/📦 Harv.id: products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/📦 Harvest hive frames and sections
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/📦 Harv.title: 📦 Harvest hive frames and sections

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/📦 Inve.id: products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/📦 Inventory management - warehouse view
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/📦 Inve.title: 📦 Inventory management - warehouse view
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/📦 Inve.description: We want beekeepers to be aware of their apiary state

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🪝 Webh.title: 🪝 Webhooks integration
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🪝 Webh.description: Similar to other integreations like Google-calendar integration, here the idea is to allow user to register a URL (webhook) that we will deliver some event to. For example a new hive added, a frame analyzed etc.

products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🪲 Hive.title: 🪲 Hive beetle detection
products/web_app/pro tier/ideas 💡/🪲 Hive.description: - bees can't really attack hive beetles
